alert.note: Alert for Appanoose; Davis; Monroe (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:59PM CDT until March 31 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MONROE...WEST CENTRAL DAVIS AND NORTHERN APPANOOSE COUNTIES... At 258 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lake Sundown, or 10 miles northeast of Centerville, moving northeast at 55 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Appanoose County. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Centerville, Lake Sundown, Rathbun Lake, Moravia, Mystic, Unionville, Rathbun, Udell and Honey Creek State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
